name: assoc
description: Displays or modifies file extension associations.

name: attrib
description: Displays or changes file attributes.

parameters.name: +r
parameters.description: Sets the read-only file attribute.

parameters.name: -r
parameters.description: Clears the read-only file attribute.

parameters.name: +a
parameters.description: Sets the archive file attribute.

parameters.name: -a
parameters.description: Clears the archive file attribute.

parameters.name: +s
parameters.description: Sets the system file attribute.

parameters.name: -s
parameters.description: Clears the system file attribute.

parameters.name: +h
parameters.description: Sets the hidden file attribute.

parameters.name: -h
parameters.description: Clears the hidden file attribute.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Processes matching files in the current folder and all subfolders.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Processes folders as well.

parameters.name: /l
parameters.description: Applies the attrib command to the symbolic link versus the target of the symbolic link.

name: break
description: Sets or clears extended CTRL+C checking.

name: bcdedit
description: Sets properties in boot database to control boot loading.

parameters.name: /set
parameters.description: Sets a boot entry option value.

parameters.name: /delete
parameters.description: Deletes an element from the boot configuration data store.

parameters.name: /deletevalue
parameters.description: Deletes a value entry.

parameters.name: /displayorder
parameters.description: Specifies the display order of boot manager menu entries.

parameters.name: /timeout
parameters.description: Sets the boot manager timeout.

parameters.name: /bootsequence
parameters.description: Specifies a one-time boot sequence.

name: cacls
description: Displays or modifies access control lists (ACLs) of files.

parameters.name: /t
parameters.description: Changes ACLs of the specified files in the current directory and all subdirectories.

parameters.name: /e
parameters.description: Edits ACL instead of replacing it.

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Continues on access denied errors.

parameters.name: /g
parameters.description: Grants specified user access rights.

parameters.name: /r
parameters.description: Revokes specified user access rights.

parameters.name: /p
parameters.description: Replaces specified user access rights.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Denies specified user access rights.

name: call
description: Calls one batch program from another.

name: cd
description: Displays the name of or changes the current directory.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Changes the drive in addition to changing the directory.

name: chcp
description: Displays or sets the active code page number.

name: chdir
description: Displays the name of or changes the current directory.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Changes the drive in addition to changing the directory.

name: chkdsk
description: Checks a disk and displays a status report.

parameters.name: /f
parameters.description: Fixes errors on the disk.

parameters.name: /r
parameters.description: Locates bad sectors and recovers readable information (implies /f).

parameters.name: /x
parameters.description: Forces the volume to dismount first if necessary (implies /f).

parameters.name: /i
parameters.description: Performs a less vigorous check of index entries (NTFS only).

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Skips checking of cycles within the folder structure (NTFS only).

parameters.name: /b
parameters.description: Re-evaluates bad clusters on the volume (NTFS only, implies /r).

parameters.name: /scan
parameters.description: Runs an online scan on the volume.

parameters.name: /spotfix
parameters.description: Performs spot fixing on the volume.

name: chkntfs
description: Displays or modifies the checking of disk at boot time.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Restores default settings.

parameters.name: /x
parameters.description: Excludes a drive from being checked at startup.

parameters.name: /t
parameters.description: Changes the AUTOCHK initiation countdown time.

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Schedules AUTOCHK on specified drives at startup.

name: cls
description: Clears the screen.

name: cmd
description: Starts a new instance of the Windows command interpreter.

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Carries out the command specified by string and then terminates.

parameters.name: /k
parameters.description: Carries out the command specified by string and remains.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Modifies the treatment of string after /c or /k.

parameters.name: /q
parameters.description: Turns echo off.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Disables execution of AutoRun commands.

parameters.name: /a
parameters.description: Formats internal command output to a pipe or file as ANSI.

parameters.name: /u
parameters.description: Formats internal command output to a pipe or file as Unicode.

parameters.name: /t
parameters.description: Sets the background/foreground color (hexadecimal values).

parameters.name: /e
parameters.description: Enables or disables command extensions.

parameters.name: /f
parameters.description: Enables or disables file and directory name completion characters.

parameters.name: /v
parameters.description: Enables or disables delayed environment variable expansion.

name: color
description: Sets the default console foreground and background colors.

name: comp
description: Compares the contents of two files or sets of files.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Displays differences in decimal format.

parameters.name: /a
parameters.description: Displays differences in ASCII format.

parameters.name: /l
parameters.description: Displays line numbers for differing lines.

parameters.name: /n
parameters.description: Compares only the specified number of lines.

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Ignores case sensitivity.

parameters.name: /off
parameters.description: Includes offline files in comparison.

name: compact
description: Displays or alters the compression of files on NTFS partitions.

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Compresses the specified files.

parameters.name: /u
parameters.description: Uncompresses the specified files.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Performs the specified operation on files in the given directory and all subdirectories.

parameters.name: /a
parameters.description: Displays files with hidden or system attributes.

parameters.name: /i
parameters.description: Continues performing the specified operation even after errors occur.

parameters.name: /f
parameters.description: Forces compression or uncompression on all specified files.

parameters.name: /q
parameters.description: Reports only the most essential information.

name: convert
description: Converts FAT volumes to NTFS. You cannot convert the current drive.

parameters.name: /fs:ntfs
parameters.description: Specifies conversion to NTFS file system.

parameters.name: /v
parameters.description: Runs the convert command in verbose mode.

parameters.name: /cvtarea
parameters.description: Specifies a contiguous file in the root directory to be the placeholder for NTFS system files.

parameters.name: /nosecurity
parameters.description: Specifies that security settings on converted files and directories allow access by all users.

parameters.name: /x
parameters.description: Forces the volume to dismount first if necessary.

name: copy
description: Copies one or more files from one location to another.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Allows the encrypted files being copied to be saved as decrypted files at the destination.

parameters.name: /v
parameters.description: Verifies that new files are written correctly.

parameters.name: /y
parameters.description: Suppresses prompting to confirm you want to overwrite an existing destination file.

parameters.name: /a
parameters.description: Indicates that the source file is an ASCII text file.

parameters.name: /b
parameters.description: Indicates that the source file is a binary file.

parameters.name: /z
parameters.description: Copies networked files in restartable mode.

parameters.name: /l
parameters.description: If the source and destination are on different volumes, creates a hard link instead of making a copy.

parameters.name: /n
parameters.description: Copies using the generated short names.

name: date
description: Displays or sets the date.

name: del
description: Deletes one or more files.

parameters.name: /p
parameters.description: Prompts for confirmation before deleting each file.

parameters.name: /f
parameters.description: Forces deletion of read-only files.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Deletes specified files from all subdirectories.

parameters.name: /q
parameters.description: Quiet mode, do not ask if ok to delete on global wildcard.

parameters.name: /a
parameters.description: Selects files to delete based on attributes.

name: dir
description: Displays a list of files and subdirectories in a directory.

parameters.name: /a
parameters.description: Displays files with specified attributes.

parameters.name: /b
parameters.description: Uses bare format (no heading information or summary).

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Displays the thousand separator in file sizes (default).

parameters.name: /-c
parameters.description: Disables display of thousand separator in file sizes.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Same as wide list format, but files are sorted by column.

parameters.name: /l
parameters.description: Displays unsorted lowercase.

parameters.name: /n
parameters.description: New long list format with file names on the far right.

parameters.name: /o
parameters.description: Lists files in sorted order.

parameters.name: /p
parameters.description: Pauses after each screen of information.

parameters.name: /q
parameters.description: Displays the owner of the file.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Displays files in the specified directory and all subdirectories.

parameters.name: /t
parameters.description: Controls which time field is displayed or used for sorting.

parameters.name: /w
parameters.description: Uses wide list format.

parameters.name: /x
parameters.description: Displays short file names generated for non-8dot3 file names.
Displays four-digit years.

name: diskpart
description: Displays or configures Disk Partition properties.

name: doskey
description: Edits command lines, recalls Windows commands, and creates macros.

parameters.name: /reinstall
parameters.description: Installs a new copy of Doskey.

parameters.name: /listsize
parameters.description: Specifies size of command history buffer.

parameters.name: /macros
parameters.description: Displays all doskey macros or those for a specific executable.

parameters.name: /history
parameters.description: Displays all commands stored in memory.

parameters.name: /insert
parameters.description: Specifies insert mode.

parameters.name: /overstrike
parameters.description: Specifies overstrike mode.

parameters.name: /exename
parameters.description: Specifies the executable file with which the macros are associated.

parameters.name: /macrofile
parameters.description: Specifies a file containing macros to install.

name: driverquery
description: Displays current device driver status and properties.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Specifies the remote system to connect to.

parameters.name: /u
parameters.description: Specifies the user context under which the command should execute.

parameters.name: /p
parameters.description: Specifies the password for the given user context.

parameters.name: /fo
parameters.description: Specifies the output format: TABLE, LIST, or CSV.

parameters.name: /nh
parameters.description: Specifies that the 'Column Header' should not be displayed in the output.

parameters.name: /v
parameters.description: Displays detailed information.

name: echo
description: Displays messages, or turns command echoing on or off.

name: endlocal
description: Ends localization of environment changes in a batch file.

name: erase
description: Deletes one or more files.

parameters.name: /p
parameters.description: Prompts for confirmation before deleting each file.

parameters.name: /f
parameters.description: Forces deletion of read-only files.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Deletes specified files from all subdirectories.

parameters.name: /q
parameters.description: Quiet mode, do not ask if ok to delete on global wildcard.

parameters.name: /a
parameters.description: Selects files to delete based on attributes.

name: exit
description: Quits the CMD.EXE program (command interpreter).

parameters.name: /b
parameters.description: Exits the current batch script instead of CMD.EXE, with optional errorlevel.

name: fc
description: Compares two files or sets of files, and displays the differences between them.

parameters.name: /a
parameters.description: Displays only first and last lines for each set of differences.

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Disregards case.

parameters.name: /l
parameters.description: Compares files as ASCII text.

parameters.name: /n
parameters.description: Displays line numbers on an ASCII comparison.

parameters.name: /t
parameters.description: Does not expand tabs to spaces.

parameters.name: /u
parameters.description: Compares files as Unicode text files.

parameters.name: /w
parameters.description: Compresses whitespace (tabs and spaces) for comparison.

parameters.name: /b
parameters.description: Performs a binary comparison.

parameters.name: /nnnn
parameters.description: Specifies the number of consecutive lines that must match after a mismatch.

name: find
description: Searches for a text string in a file or files.

parameters.name: /v
parameters.description: Displays all lines not containing the specified string.

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Displays only the count of lines containing the string.

parameters.name: /n
parameters.description: Displays line numbers with the output lines.

parameters.name: /i
parameters.description: Ignores case in the search.

name: findstr
description: Searches for strings in files.

parameters.name: /b
parameters.description: Matches pattern if at the beginning of a line.

parameters.name: /e
parameters.description: Matches pattern if at the end of a line.

parameters.name: /l
parameters.description: Uses search string literally.

parameters.name: /r
parameters.description: Uses search strings as regular expressions.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Searches for matching files in the current directory and all subdirectories.

parameters.name: /i
parameters.description: Specifies that the search is not to be case-sensitive.

parameters.name: /x
parameters.description: Prints lines that match exactly.

parameters.name: /v
parameters.description: Prints only lines not containing a match.

parameters.name: /n
parameters.description: Prints the line number before each line that matches.

parameters.name: /m
parameters.description: Prints only the file name if a file contains a match.

parameters.name: /o
parameters.description: Prints character offset before each matching line.

parameters.name: /p
parameters.description: Skips files with non-printable characters.

parameters.name: /offline
parameters.description: Does not skip files with offline attribute set.

parameters.name: /f
parameters.description: Specifies a file that contains a list of files to search.

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Uses the specified text as a literal search string.

parameters.name: /g
parameters.description: Specifies a file that contains strings to be searched for.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Searches in a directory list.

name: for
description: Runs a specified command for each file in a set of files.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Process folders that match the specified set of names.

parameters.name: /r
parameters.description: Walks the directory tree rooted at the specified directory.

parameters.name: /l
parameters.description: Iterates over a range of values.

parameters.name: /f
parameters.description: Iterates over the output of a command, or the contents of a file, or literal strings.

name: format
description: Formats a disk for use with Windows.

parameters.name: /fs
parameters.description: Specifies the file system type: FAT, FAT32, exFAT, NTFS, UDF.

parameters.name: /v
parameters.description: Specifies the volume label.

parameters.name: /q
parameters.description: Performs a quick format.

parameters.name: /x
parameters.description: Forces the volume to dismount first if necessary.

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: NTFS only: Files created on the new volume will be compressed by default.

parameters.name: /p
parameters.description: Specifies the number of passes that zero every sector.

name: fsutil
description: Displays or configures the file system properties.

name: ftype
description: Displays or modifies file types used in file extension associations.

name: goto
description: Directs the Windows command interpreter to a labeled line in a batch program.

name: gpresult
description: Displays Group Policy information for machine or user.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Specifies the remote system to connect to.

parameters.name: /u
parameters.description: Specifies the user context under which the command should execute.

parameters.name: /p
parameters.description: Specifies the password for the given user context.

parameters.name: /r
parameters.description: Displays RSoP summary data.

parameters.name: /v
parameters.description: Specifies verbose mode; provides additional detailed settings information.

parameters.name: /z
parameters.description: Specifies super-verbose mode; provides all available information about policy.

parameters.name: /scope
parameters.description: Specifies whether user or computer settings need to be displayed.

name: help
description: Provides Help information for Windows commands.

name: icacls
description: Display, modify, backup, or restore ACLs for files and directories.

parameters.name: /grant
parameters.description: Grants specified user access rights.

parameters.name: /deny
parameters.description: Explicitly denies specified user access rights.

parameters.name: /remove
parameters.description: Removes all occurrences of specified user permissions.

parameters.name: /inheritance
parameters.description: Enable or disable inheritance for specified file or directory.

parameters.name: /setowner
parameters.description: Changes the ownership of specified files or directories.

parameters.name: /save
parameters.description: Saves ACLs for specified files and directories.

parameters.name: /restore
parameters.description: Restores ACLs that were saved previously with the /save option.

parameters.name: /verify
parameters.description: Finds all files whose ACLs are not in canonical form or have lengths inconsistent with ACE counts.

parameters.name: /reset
parameters.description: Replaces ACLs with default inherited ACLs.

name: if
description: Performs conditional processing in batch programs.
example: if exist file.txt echo File exists

parameters.name: not
parameters.description: Specifies that Windows should carry out the command only if the condition is false.

parameters.name: errorlevel
parameters.description: Specifies a true condition if the last program run returned an exit code greater than or equal to a number.

parameters.name: cmdextversion
parameters.description: Specifies a true condition if the internal command extensions are at least a specified version.

parameters.name: defined
parameters.description: Specifies a true condition if the environment variable is defined.

name: label
description: Creates, changes, or deletes the volume label of a disk.

name: md
description: Creates a directory.

name: mkdir
description: Creates a directory (same as md).

name: mklink
description: Creates symbolic links and hard links.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Creates a directory symbolic link.

parameters.name: /h
parameters.description: Creates a hard link instead of a symbolic link.

parameters.name: /j
parameters.description: Creates a Directory Junction.

name: mode
description: Configures system devices.

name: more
description: Displays output one screen at a time.

parameters.name: /e
parameters.description: Enable extended features.

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Clear screen before displaying page.

parameters.name: /p
parameters.description: Expand form-feed characters.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Squeeze multiple blank lines into a single line.

parameters.name: /t
parameters.description: Expand tabs to n spaces (default 8).

name: move
description: Moves one or more files from one directory to another.

parameters.name: /y
parameters.description: Suppresses prompting to confirm you want to overwrite an existing destination file.

parameters.name: /-y
parameters.description: Causes prompting to confirm you want to overwrite an existing destination file.

name: openfiles
description: Displays files opened remotely through a local share.

parameters.name: /query
parameters.description: Displays information about open files.

parameters.name: /disconnect
parameters.description: Closes open files and disconnects users.

parameters.name: /local
parameters.description: Enables or disables the display of local files.

name: path
description: Displays or sets a search path for executable files.

name: pause
description: Suspends processing of a batch file and displays a message.

name: popd
description: Restores the previous value of the current directory saved by pushd.

name: print
description: Prints a text file.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Specifies the printer device.

name: prompt
description: Changes the Windows command prompt.

name: pushd
description: Saves the current directory then changes it.

name: rd
description: Removes (deletes) a directory.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Removes all directories and files in the specified directory in addition to the directory itself.

parameters.name: /q
parameters.description: Quiet mode, do not ask if ok to remove on global wildcard.

name: rmdir
description: Removes (deletes) a directory (same as rd).

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Removes all directories and files in the specified directory.

parameters.name: /q
parameters.description: Quiet mode, do not ask if ok to remove on global wildcard.

name: robocopy
description: Advanced utility to copy files and directory trees.

parameters.name: /mir
parameters.description: Mirrors a directory tree (equivalent to /e plus deletion of files not in source).

parameters.name: /e
parameters.description: Copies subdirectories, including empty ones.

parameters.name: /copyall
parameters.description: Copies all file info (equivalent to /copy:DATSOU).

parameters.name: /r
parameters.description: Specifies the number of retries on failed copies (default is 1 million).

parameters.name: /w
parameters.description: Specifies the wait time between retries in seconds (default 30).

parameters.name: /xo
parameters.description: Excludes older files.

parameters.name: /xn
parameters.description: Excludes newer files.

parameters.name: /xc
parameters.description: Excludes changed files.

parameters.name: /xn /xo /xc
parameters.description: Excludes files according to multiple criteria.

parameters.name: /log
parameters.description: Outputs status to a log file.

parameters.name: /np
parameters.description: No progress – don’t display percentage copied.

parameters.name: /tee
parameters.description: Outputs to console window, as well as the log file.

name: set
description: Displays, sets, or removes Windows environment variables.

name: setlocal
description: Begins localization of environment changes in a batch file.

parameters.name: enabledelayedexpansion
parameters.description: Enables delayed environment variable expansion.

parameters.name: disabledelayedexpansion
parameters.description: Disables delayed environment variable expansion.

name: sc
description: Displays or configures services (background processes).

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Displays status of a service.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Starts a service.

parameters.name: stop
parameters.description: Stops a service.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Configures a service.

parameters.name: create
parameters.description: Creates a new service.

parameters.name: delete
parameters.description: Deletes a service.

name: schtasks
description: Schedules commands and programs to run on a computer.

parameters.name: /create
parameters.description: Creates a new scheduled task.

parameters.name: /delete
parameters.description: Deletes a scheduled task.

parameters.name: /query
parameters.description: Displays scheduled tasks.

parameters.name: /run
parameters.description: Runs a scheduled task immediately.

parameters.name: /change
parameters.description: Changes the properties of a scheduled task.

parameters.name: /tn
parameters.description: Specifies the task name.

parameters.name: /tr
parameters.description: Specifies the task to run.

parameters.name: /sc
parameters.description: Specifies the schedule frequency: minute, hourly, daily, weekly, monthly, once, onstart, onlogon, onidle.

parameters.name: /st
parameters.description: Specifies the start time of the task.

parameters.name: /ru
parameters.description: Specifies the user account to run the task under.

parameters.name: /rp
parameters.description: Specifies the password for the given user account.

name: shift
description: Shifts the position of replaceable parameters in batch files.

name: shutdown
description: Allows proper local or remote shutdown of machine.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Shuts down the computer.

parameters.name: /r
parameters.description: Restarts the computer.

parameters.name: /l
parameters.description: Logs off the current user.

parameters.name: /t
parameters.description: Specifies the time delay in seconds before shutdown.

parameters.name: /f
parameters.description: Forces running applications to close.

parameters.name: /m
parameters.description: Specifies the target remote computer.

name: sort
description: Sorts input.

parameters.name: /r
parameters.description: Reverses the sort order.

parameters.name: /+n
parameters.description: Specifies the character number, n, to begin each comparison.

name: start
description: Starts a separate window to run a specified program or command.

parameters.name: /min
parameters.description: Starts the window minimized.

parameters.name: /max
parameters.description: Starts the window maximized.

parameters.name: /wait
parameters.description: Starts the application and waits for it to terminate.

parameters.name: /b
parameters.description: Starts the application without creating a new window.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Specifies the starting directory.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Specifies the window title.

name: subst
description: Associates a path with a drive letter.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Deletes the virtual drive.

name: systeminfo
description: Displays machine specific properties and configuration.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Specifies a remote system to connect to.

parameters.name: /u
parameters.description: Specifies the user context under which the command should execute.

parameters.name: /p
parameters.description: Specifies the password for the given user context.

parameters.name: /fo
parameters.description: Specifies the output format: TABLE, LIST, CSV.

parameters.name: /nh
parameters.description: Specifies that the 'Column Header' should not be displayed in the output.

name: tasklist
description: Displays all currently running tasks including services.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Specifies a remote system to connect to.

parameters.name: /u
parameters.description: Specifies the user context.

parameters.name: /p
parameters.description: Specifies the password for the user context.

parameters.name: /m
parameters.description: Lists tasks that use the specified DLL.

parameters.name: /svc
parameters.description: Displays services hosted in each process.

parameters.name: /v
parameters.description: Specifies verbose mode.

name: taskkill
description: Kill or stop a running process or application.

parameters.name: /f
parameters.description: Forces termination of the process.

parameters.name: /im
parameters.description: Specifies the image name of the process to be terminated.

parameters.name: /pid
parameters.description: Specifies the process ID to be terminated.

parameters.name: /t
parameters.description: Terminates the specified process and any child processes started by it.

name: time
description: Displays or sets the system time.

name: title
description: Sets the window title for a CMD.EXE session.

name: tree
description: Graphically displays the directory structure of a drive or path.

parameters.name: /f
parameters.description: Displays the names of the files in each folder.

parameters.name: /a
parameters.description: Uses ASCII instead of extended characters.

name: type
description: Displays the contents of a text file.

name: ver
description: Displays the Windows version.

name: verify
description: Tells Windows whether to verify that your files are written correctly to a disk.

name: vol
description: Displays a disk volume label and serial number.

name: xcopy
description: Copies files and directory trees.

parameters.name: /s
parameters.description: Copies directories and subdirectories except empty ones.

parameters.name: /e
parameters.description: Copies all subdirectories, including empty ones.

parameters.name: /h
parameters.description: Copies hidden and system files also.

parameters.name: /y
parameters.description: Suppresses prompting to confirm overwrite of destination file(s).

parameters.name: /-y
parameters.description: Prompts to confirm overwrite of destination file(s).

parameters.name: /c
parameters.description: Continues copying even if errors occur.

parameters.name: /i
parameters.description: If destination does not exist and copying more than one file, assumes that destination must be a directory.

parameters.name: /r
parameters.description: Overwrites read-only files.

parameters.name: /d
parameters.description: Copies only files changed on or after the specified date.

parameters.name: /t
parameters.description: Creates directory structure, but does not copy files.

parameters.name: /u
parameters.description: Copies only files that already exist in destination.

name: wmic
description: Displays WMI information inside interactive command shell.

parameters.name: /node
parameters.description: Specifies the target computer.

parameters.name: /user
parameters.description: Specifies the user context.

parameters.name: /password
parameters.description: Specifies the password for the user.

parameters.name: /output
parameters.description: Specifies the output format or file.

parameters.name: /format
parameters.description: Specifies output format: table, list, csv, etc.
